headline: NYT Avoids Netflix-Style Password Crackdowns, Leans On Premium Family Plans
summary: The New York Times Co. (NYSE:NYT) is leveraging a “carrot” approach to monetization, using premium Family Plans to drive growth while avoiding the aggressive password-sharing crackdowns that recently triggered public backlash against Netflix Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX). The Carrot Vs. The Stick While Netflix opted for a “stick” approach—systematically blocking unauthorized users and requiring device verification—The New York Times is focusing on voluntary incentives. headline: Disney Fights Against TikTok Parent’s AI Video Model. Big Money Is at Stake.
summary: Seedance 2.0 has flooded the internet with AI-generated videos of beloved actors and characters. Disney is taking aim at its owner ByteDance.

headline: Disney’s Legal Battles Test IP Value In Streaming And AI Partnerships
summary: Disney (NYSE:DIS) is defending its intellectual property in multiple courts as it faces a patent infringement injunction in Germany. The company is also pursuing legal action against ByteDance over alleged unauthorized use of Disney IP in an AI video tool. These moves come as Disney’s licensing and streaming businesses intersect more directly with fast growing AI driven media platforms. For you as an investor, these cases sit at the intersection of Disney’s core strengths in characters,...

headline: ByteDance to prevent unauthorized IP use on AI video after Disney threat
summary: STORY: Bytedance will take steps to stop the unauthorized use of intellectual property on its new AI video generator.The Chinese firm made the announcement Monday (February 16) following legal threats from U.S. studios, including Disney.Seedance 2.0 was released last week and videos made on it have gone viral in China.The AI model has been praised for its ability to produce cinematic storylines with only a few prompts.However, a source told Reuters Disney sent a cease-and-desist letter to ByteDance.They said the U.S. giant accused the Chinese firm of using Disney characters to train and power Seedance without permission.While Bytedance said it was working to improve current safeguards over unauthorized use of intellectual property, it didn't describe the measures it was taking.Variety reported Paramount Skydance also sent a cease-and-desist letter to ByteDance.It reportedly accused the Chinese company of "blatant infringement" of its intellectual property.Disney's move comes months after it signed a licensing deal with OpenAI.It allows the startup to use characters from Star Wars, Pixar and Marvel franchises in its Sora video generator.

raw.headline: ByteDance to prevent unauthorized IP use on AI video after Disney threat
raw.summary: STORY: Bytedance will take steps to stop the unauthorized use of intellectual property on its new AI video generator.The Chinese firm made the announcement Monday (February 16) following legal threats from U.S. studios, including Disney.Seedance 2.0 was released last week and videos made on it have gone viral in China.The AI model has been praised for its ability to produce cinematic storylines with only a few prompts.However, a source told Reuters Disney sent a cease-and-desist letter to ByteDance.They said the U.S. giant accused the Chinese firm of using Disney characters to train and power Seedance without permission.While Bytedance said it was working to improve current safeguards over unauthorized use of intellectual property, it didn't describe the measures it was taking.Variety reported Paramount Skydance also sent a cease-and-desist letter to ByteDance.It reportedly accused the Chinese company of "blatant infringement" of its intellectual property.Disney's move comes months after it signed a licensing deal with OpenAI.It allows the startup to use characters from Star Wars, Pixar and Marvel franchises in its Sora video generator.

headline: McDonald's Tests High Protein Menu As GLP-1 Weight-Loss Drug Users Surge
summary: McDonald’s Corporation (NYSE:MCD) is adapting its menu as a growing number of Americans on GLP-1 weight-loss drugs, such as Ozempic and Wegovy, alter portion sizes, snacking habits, and beverage choices. McDonald's Tests High-Protein Options For GLP-1 Users During a Wednesday earnings call, CEO Chris Kempczinski said McDonald's is testing menu items to appeal to customers taking GLP-1 medications. headline: ByteDance vows to boost safeguards after AI model infringement claims
summary: Chinese tech giant ByteDance said it was taking steps to "strengthen current safeguards" after Hollywood heavyweights accused its new AI video model of copyright infringement.It added it was taking steps to "strengthen current safeguards" to prevent "unauthorised use of intellectual property and likeness by users".

headline: 1 Cash-Producing Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Avoid
summary: Generating cash is essential for any business, but not all cash-rich companies are great investments. Some produce plenty of cash but fail to allocate it effectively, leading to missed opportunities.

raw.headline: 1 Cash-Producing Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Avoid
raw.summary: Generating cash is essential for any business, but not all cash-rich companies are great investments. Some produce plenty of cash but fail to allocate it effectively, leading to missed opportunities.

headline: Companies Are Replacing CEOs in Record Numbers—and They’re Getting Younger
summary: There hasn’t been such a big crop of new leaders running Corporate America in at least 16 years, and they have their hands full.
